title: Executive Order 6179-C-Designation of South Trimble, Jr., as Acting Secretary of Commerce
content: Pursuant to the authority contained in Section 179 of the Revised Statutes (U.S.C. Title 5, Section 6), I hereby authorize and direct South Trimble, Jr., Solicitor for the Department of Commerce, to perform the duties of the Secretary of Commerce during the absence of the Secretary of Commerce and the Assistant Secretaries of Commerce appointed under the Act of February 14, 1903, as amended by the Act of March 4, 1913, and the Act of May 20, 1926.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6179-C-Designation of South Trimble, Jr., as Acting Secretary of Commerce Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362000
